document_name: Support to Indonesia's Energy Efficiency Testing and Certification Facilities and Expertise-JPF Approval letter

outputs.output_descr:
BRESL will facilitate the transformation of the manufacture and sale of energy-efficient appliances and equipment through: 1) A regional initiative in Asia, with provision for general information, tools and training to all interested developing countries in the region plus customized efforts, all with a focus on regional cooperation; and, 2) National technical assistance to 5 developing countries in Asia. The project will focus largely on capacity building and assisting government, manufacturing, distributing, retail, consumer and environmental stakeholders throughout the Asian region to implement the most cost-effective energy efficiency measure available. In each participating country, priority activities will be carried out to help foster each country's preferred process for developing or expanding its ES&L program.

Component 1: Legal and regulatory basis for removing lowest EE technologies from the market and promoting high-efficiency technologies established.
Component 2: Institutional and individual capacity to secure on-the-ground implementation of regulatory frameworks, as well as actual standards and labeling programs developed.
Component 3:  Information and technical assistance to manufacturers of covered products provided.
Component 4:  Regional cooperation and information sharing functional.
Component 5: Pilot project set up demonstrating various aspects of the development and implementation of ES&L programs.

The project aims to fill the gaps of the GEF-funded BRESL project, namely the lack of technical expertise and equipment of Indonesian energy efficiency testing facilities. It is widely acknowledged that the availability of appropriate testing ES&L facilities and related technical capacity plays an important role in advancing energy efficiency, and also that Japan is a world leader in the area of energy efficient appliances and associated policies.

project_descr:
BARRIER REMOVAL TO THE COST-EFFECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AND
IMPLEMENTATION OF ENERGY EFFICIENCY STANDARDS AND LABELING
PROJECT (BRESL)
